channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Inline Related Posts
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Inline Related Posts

item.title: CVE-2024-5626|2024-07-12T20:17:44.270Z -- unknown -- inline%20related%20posts
item.description: The Inline Related Posts WordPress plugin before 3.7.0 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2023-6257|2024-06-04T17:17:20.622Z -- unknown -- inline%20related%20posts
item.description: The Inline Related Posts WordPress plugin before 3.6.0 does not ensure that post content displayed via an AJAX action are accessible to the user, allowing any authenticated user, such as subscriber to retrieve the content of password protected posts

item.title: CVE-2024-2444|2024-04-08T17:28:12.009Z -- unknown -- inline%20related%20posts
item.description: The Inline Related Posts WordPress plugin before 3.5.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as Admin to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when unfiltered_html is disallowed

item.title: CVE-2024-5626|2024-07-12T06:00:06.094Z -- unknown -- inline%20related%20posts
item.description: The Inline Related Posts WordPress plugin before 3.7.0 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin
